883710301:
[

Sales Support Coordinator

Company Name Medibank Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 100 views

Job description

We are Medibank – an integrated healthcare company providing private health insurance and health solutions to 3.7 million Australians.


At Medibank we stand for better health for better lives.

\xa0

About Us

We're passionate about nurturing careers.


We support new innovation and thinking, and openly collaborate and share new ideas. We're healthy and active in our lives and wellbeing is encouraged at every level. Our people play an important role in the future of health and healthcare and we believe that working together, we're stronger.


The Opportunity

An exciting opportunity exists for a Sale Support Coordinator to join our Customer Relationship Management team in our Sydney CBD office.


The primary focus of the Sale Support Coordinator will be to provide administrative support to the Relationship Management team.

\xa0

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Attending customer meetings and providing administrative support such as diary management, agenda preparation, minute taking, and management of action registers and preparation of PowerPoint presentations.
  • Identifying customer concerns, escalating issues to the Relationship Manager and complaint management.
  • Acting as the main point of contact, liaising with both the client and internal stakeholders to manage the delivery of customer complaints including the preparation of the written complaint responses in a client suitable format.
  • Review, validate and deliver customer and sales reports with the view to analyse/identify trends and opportunities.
  • Act as key liaison point for customers in the event a Relationship Manager is unavailable.
  • Adhoc project work (team/role oriented).
  • Develop and maintain an up to date working understanding of all Telehealth programs and services.

\xa0

About You

We are looking for a proactive, switched on and confident individual with strong communication and IT skills and the ability to liaise with both internal and external stakeholders.


You possess solid administrative management skills with a real knack for identifying efficiencies and establishing order. You have high attention to detail and are able to support the team in making quick commercially savvy decisions in a busy with multiple envrionment competing priorities.


Your ability to write comprehensive reports and complaint management skills will be key drivers for success in this role and any previous relevant experience to those should be highlighted in your resume. Please note previous experience within health is essential to the role.


What We Offer

In return for your hard work we offer a range of great benefits, including subsidised private health insurance, travel insurance and pet insurance. Furthermore, we take the health and wellbeing of our employees seriously, offering flexible working conditions and encouraging wellbeing at all levels of life.


Medibank is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.


A Career at Medibank adds up to more. More achievement. More progress. More passion and more innovation for health.


For a career option that will suit you better, click to apply with a resume and cover letter.


For a confidential discussion, please email Nicola.Gala@medibank.com.au


Please note, if this position attracts a large volume of interest, the closing date for applications may be brought forward. With this in mind, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.

886088646:
[

PR Manager

Company Name THE ICONIC Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 53 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

THE ICONIC is a truly unique brand. We entered the market in 2011 with the vision of defining the future of fashion retail. Since then we have created a brand known throughout ANZ by connecting 20-35yr old shoppers with the best fashion and sports product through the most inspiring and rewarding shopping experience.


THE ICONIC stands for benchmark-setting experiences (3HR delivery, access to over 800 top brands, market-leading shopping app), for impassioned communities (connecting Australians fashion and sports lovers through digital innovation), and for our love of the newest in fashion from our 800+ leading local and international brands. \xa0We want to inspire Australians and New Zealanders to constantly explore new sides of their identity, and have a whole lot of fun doing it.


  • “We Dream Big” – you will have a vision for how we can become a data-driven company to derive competitive advantage

  • “We Are True to our Customers” – you will be inherently passionate about customer impact, both external and internal customers, and will constantly challenge yourself and the team to deliver more customer value

  • “We Get Things Done” – you do not want to work in a cumbersome organisation, you want to work in an agile high-growth company. You lead with the right balance of planning and pragmatism.

  • “We Are Stronger Together” – you are an experienced and capable leader. You will galvanise your peers and inspire the broader organisation towards your vision.


ABOUT THE ROLE


THE ICONIC is looking for a PR Manager who is ready for a once-in-a-lifetime career opportunity working with our Head of PR on external communications (inc. influencer marketing) for one of Australia’s most exciting and fastest growing businesses.


WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR


We're on the hunt for an experienced PR professional who is customer-obsessed and is interested in making a lasting impact on a rapidly growing and innovative company by leading with a hands-on approach.


This role requires strategic, creative thinking, and a passion for storytelling that captures the attention of both media and our customers via influencer and social channels.


You will be able to self-manage, juggle multiple projects at once and keep pace in a fast-moving business. A real ‘people-person’, you will thrive on building and maintaining strong working relationships across the business. The right candidate will also require an understanding of corporate communications to tell stories about the company’s growth, who we are and what we stand for.


Specifically you are / have:


  • At least 5 years’ experience in PR (agency or in-house)
  • You must have worked with influencers in a strategic capacity\xa0\xa0
  • Strong connections in the industry and a wide array of reliable media relationships
  • Ideally some experience working with New Zealand media
  • An ‘SEO mindset’ when it comes to PR
  • Proven track record for ‘data-driven’ storytelling
  • An ability to multi-task and problem solve autonomously, as well as demonstrate critical thinking
  • An ability to confidently deliver communications counsel to THE ICONIC’s senior leadership team and executives
  • A bold sense of confidence and trust in yourself\xa0\xa0
  • Enjoy a fast pace, constant change and feel comfortable in a ‘test and learn’ environment where we’re often doing things for the first time
  • Brilliant verbal and written communication skills (inc. the ability to write strategic plans, press releases and key messaging with ease)
  • Crisis management experiences
  • An enthusiastic attitude and a genuine love of our brand

This is NOT just a fashion PR role - while we all have a love of fashion at THE ICONIC and experience in such is a bonus, the position requires a broad amount of expertise. The right candidate will have extensive experience moving between consumer, corporate, tech and lifestyle PR remits effortlessly.


YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Work closely with our Head of PR and wider marketing team (i.e. creative, social, brand and commercial teams) to develop PR strategies that will amplify key marketing activity (inc. campaigns, major trade activity, partner brand activity etc) throughout the year

  • Driving consistent proactive coverage across all areas - fashion, consumer lifestyle, business & tech - outside of key marketing activity

  • Day-to-day management of inbound media requests (Australia and New Zealand) for product and business information together with local PR agency

  • Identify ‘data-driven’ storytelling opportunities (as well as storytelling opportunities in general) together with local PR agency - even though THE ICONIC always has something to say, you should have an innate knack for ‘creating news out of nothing’

  • Build and manage relationships with company spokespeople to ensure consistent presence in media

  • Drafting of briefing documents and materials for spokespeople ahead of interview opportunities

  • Maintain relationships with industry peers to help drive mutually beneficial storytelling opportunities

  • Manage the PR agency team day-to-day

  • Monitor media on a day-to-day basis and provide key updates to the business

  • Oversee the management of the press showroom with agency support

  • Work closely with in-house social media team to identify and build relationships with prominent influencers and thought leaders in our space to develop long-terms authentic relationships. Ensure that these relationships benefit both the company and individual.

  • Attend relevant events to evangelise the company mission and find like-minded individuals and companies to align with on future initiatives.

  • Match our internal content creation with external influencers for alignment on activity where relevant.

  • Brainstorm new, creative approaches to working closer with the influential members of our industry, and serve as a go-to resource to the rest of the marketing team.


WHAT’S ON OFFER


THE ICONIC is a unique business with so many equally important facets from fashion to tech, to our start-up heritage and culture. With us, you will find an exciting blend of a vibrant start-up environment and yet professional operations in our office in the heart of Sydney.


Reporting to THE ICONIC’s Head of PR, this role sits within the Marketing team and together you drive PR and influencer marketing for THE ICONIC. You will have full oversight of THE ICONIC’s PR strategy and work directly with key company stakeholders to implement various programs to meet a very broad range of business objectives.


In flexible structures with motivated colleagues, you will have the potential to play a key role at THE ICONIC for inspiring and liberating our customers, as well as truly impact the future of fashion retail in Australia and New Zealand.


This role will become your legacy and be your most career defining moment to date.

Research Scientist - Energy and Economic Modelling

Company Name CSIRO Company Location Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 10 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Use your experience to develop techno-economic models of Australia's energy sector!
  • Undertake research with real-world impact!
  • Join CSIRO Energy and make a difference!


The Position

CSIRO Energy is seeking an experienced Research Scientist to develop techno-economic models of Australia’s energy sector to assess existing and emerging energy technologies, sector trends and policy directions.


Your duties will include:

  • Developing, applying and interpreting techno-economic models of the energy system, particularly the Australian electricity and transport sectors.
  • Evaluating the potential impact of current or proposed policies on stakeholders across the energy sector value chain.
  • Identifying and integrating key energy sector datasets from across Australia and internationally.
  • Producing reports for key industry and government clients from across the energy sector and contribute to quality science publications.
  • Contributing to the development of innovative concepts and ideas for further research.


Location: \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Newcastle, NSW, Australia preferred, other locations considered
Salary: \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 $97k to $105k plus up to 15.4% superannuation
Tenure: \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Indefinite
Job reference:\xa0 58414


To be successful, you will need:

  • A PhD in a relevant field (e.g. economics, electrical engineering, applied mathematics, science) and/or at least three years of relevant professional experience working in the energy industry.
  • Experience in Linear Programming, Non-Linear Programming or Mixed-integer Programming problems in the General Algebraic Modelling System programming language.
  • To be able to work with large data sets, including identification and integration of data relevant to the energy sector and the use of contemporary database management systems (e.g. PostgreSQL and MySQL).
  • Experience in working on multiple projects simultaneously for internal and external clients.


Before you apply, please view the full position details and selection criteria here:\xa0

https://jobs.csiro.au/job/Newcastle%2C-NSW-Research-Scientist-Energy-and-Economic-Modelling/506010600/

About CSIRO \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0


We imagine. We collaborate. We innovate.

At CSIRO, we do the extraordinary every day. We innovate for tomorrow and help improve today – for our customers, all Australians and the world. We do this by using science and technology to solve real issues. Diversity is the compass that navigates our innovation. We provide an inclusive workplace that respects, values and actively pursues the benefits of a diverse workforce.


We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you. Find out more Balance


How to Apply:\xa0 Please load one document containing your CV and cover letter outlining your motivation and suitability for the role (Maximum 2 MB).


Applications close:\xa010.59 pm (AEDT), Sunday, 21st October 2018

Do you have experience working with Airline Loyalty programs? Are you looking for a role where you can influence a major customer account? Do you deliver superior results for your customers?


As a member of our newly created Loyalty team, you will play an important role in managing the re-engineering of our Loyalty platform, and delivering an unforgettable customer experience. Your key responsibility will be aligning the strategic vision of one of Australia's most well-known airlines, with Amadeus' goals to shape the future of travel across Australia and New Zealand.


Partnering with our product marketing team, our R&D divisions, and our innovative customer, you will enable and support the delivery of new functionality and customer benefits within the Loyalty platform. Using your analytical skills, you'll strategically assess customer needs against product features, and guide the creation of new concepts and system enhancements.

  • The ability to lead and direct multiple projects simultaneously and manage multiple priorities

HOW TO APPLY

Job description

  • Multi-award winning national retailer
  • Over 100 stores and 3,500 employees
  • Part of Australia’s fastest growing and largest consumer electronics retailing group
  • Full time and Part time positions available


About us

When the first store opened in Melbourne’s northern suburbs in 1952, The Good Guys’ philosophy was then as it is now – to delight customers and ‘do good’.


From those humble beginnings, The Good Guys quickly became a household name, setting the standard for customer satisfaction and community giving, while continually evolving to meet ever-changing customer needs.


With over 100 stores and more than 3,500 employees nationwide, our Brand promise is to help Australian families live better at home for less.


Now united with JB Hi-Fi Limited, The Good Guys is part of Australia’s fastest growing and largest consumer electronics retailer and a new force in Australian retailing.

\xa0

About you/the role

We’re looking for Warehouse Team Members to assist us in carrying out the day to day warehouse activities in our exciting new store opening in Moore Park


You come to us with a proven track record of delivering exceptional customer service and previous experience in a retail warehouse. You know you play a central role in providing a positive customer experience by supporting the sales team in delivering the needs of customers and getting the products in their hands with minimal fuss.


Communication is key to successfully working as a team and you persevere by pushing yourself and others in contributing to the team’s success. An ordinary day will see you juggling any number of duties including receiving goods from suppliers, coordinating customer pick-up and delivery, and managing inventory levels – all while continuously looking to optimise warehouse space and ensuring accuracy of invoicing and record keeping. You’ll also play a critical role in store compliance by managing stock takes and ensuring safe working practices in the use of equipment and machinery.


A current picker’s license will make you a valuable asset to the team.


This is a role where you'll be challenged every day to make a difference in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. You’ll have the opportunity to continuously improve your skills and knowledge through online platforms and other development opportunities.


We offer great employee discounts and special offers, Paid Maternity Leave, Novated Leasing, and we’ll also match every dollar you donate in our Doing Good workplace giving program.

\xa0

To apply

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity with us, please click apply and upload your CV. All applications are strictly confidential.

\xa0

The Good Guys recognises the importance of diversity, and appreciates that different perspectives encourage innovation and create value for our customers.

886000507:
[

Triple Zero Emergency Call-Takers - Police

Company Name ESTA (Emergency Services Telecommunications Authority) Company Location Williams Landing, AU

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

ESTA is the critical link between the Victorian community and the state's emergency services agencies and it partners with the agencies to improve service delivery to the community. It provides Victoria's 24-hour emergency call-taking and dispatch services for police, fire, ambulance and VICSES and manages the provision of advanced, operational communications for police, ambulance, fire services and the SES. Its vision is to be a high-performing team trusted by the community and our partners to deliver the right emergency response and its central goal is to save lives and prevent harm through speed and accuracy in emergency operations.
Do you have what it takes to become an emergency '000' call-taker?
  • Are you motivated to make a vital contribution to the Victorian community?
  • Do you take pride in your work performance?
If you answered ‘yes' a career as an emergency call-taker could be right for you.

About ESTA

ESTA is the critical link between the Victorian community and the state's emergency services agencies and it partners with the agencies to improve service delivery to the community. It provides Victoria's 24-hour emergency call-taking and dispatch services for police, fire, ambulance and VICSES and manages the provision of advanced, operational communications for police, ambulance, fire services and the SES. Its vision is to be a high-performing team trusted by the community and our partners to deliver the right emergency response and its central goal is to save lives and prevent harm through speed and accuracy in emergency operations.

About The Role

Call-Takers receive and process triple zero ‘000' emergency calls from the Victorian community ensuring a quick response from fire, police, ambulance or SES services. The outcome of this is lives being saved, offenders being apprehended, fires being controlled and serious incidents being managed.

We have a community first focus and our people are committed to achieving the best possible outcomes in an emergency response. Our team members are dedicated and highly skilled. We work hard with a strong performance focus as every second counts in an emergency situation.

Our work is challenging but rewarding. We offer comprehensive training with career pathways available in emergency communications.

Looking after ourselves is a key strength in order to help others. We believe that individual safety, wellbeing and mental health are key drivers to high performance.

What We Are Looking For
  • Community-minded individuals with a passion for helping people
  • The ability to multi-task, demonstrate accuracy, speed, empathy and resilience in a structured, time critical environment
  • Superior communication skills to manage extreme situations in a calm and controlled manner
  • Critical thinking ability to make important quick and accurate decisions.

To find out more about this rewarding career opportunity, please download a copy of the Applicant Information Kit .

In 2020, ESTA has a new state of the art emergency communication centre opening at Williams Landing. We are now recruiting for Police Call-takers to be based at our current Docklands centre for approximately 12 months, with an expectation to relocate to Williams Landing early 2020.

Note: We have Police Call-taking positions commencing in October 2018 and February 2019.

E STA is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and offers reasonable adjustment to people with a disability on request.

Entry level

  • Government Administration
  • Hospital & Health Care

ABC Entertainment & Specialist is looking for a Digital Producer to join their Indigenous team.

This Role Will See You Responsible For
  • Researching, planning, producing, writing, editing and directing audio and screen content
  • Directing the editing of complex packages and sequences
  • Identifying and generating original content and story ideas
  • Assisting with day-to-day maintenance of the ABC Indigenous gateway


About You

You will have a knowledge and understanding of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures, and an understanding of the issues affecting Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people. You will have an ability to communicate sensitively and effectively with Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people.

You Will Also Have
  • Experience in devising, writing and editing high quality content
  • Proven planning, organisational and problem-solving skills
  • Advanced understanding of social media platforms
  • Experience in digital content production systems and tools
  • Accomplished directing and audio editing skills

For an overview of the role, please refer to the position description: PD - Digital Producer.pdf

We would love to see your work! Please submit material with your application online (include examples, links to websites or attach audio/video files up to 5MB).

For further information please contact Kelrick Martin, Head Indigenous on (02) 8333 4048

Applications Close: 12 November 2018

For more information on working at the ABC visit abc.net.au/careers

Recruitment Agency applications will not be accepted

Advertised: 26 Sep 2018 12:00 PM AUS Eastern Standard Time
Applications close: 12 Oct 2018 11:55 PM AUS Eastern Daylight Time

NDIS Local Area Coordinator - Queanbeyan

Company Name Uniting Company Location Queanbeyan, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Proactively drive change
  • Fixed Term Contract Unitl 30 June 2019
  • Queanbeyan, NSW


About Us

At Uniting, we believe in taking real steps to make the world a better place. We work to inspire people, enliven communities and confront injustice. We commit to respecting children and take action to keep them safe. Our services are in the areas of aged care and disability, community services, and chaplaincy and we get involved in social justice and advocacy issues that impact the people we serve. We commit to respecting children and take action to keep them safe.

As an organisation we celebrate our diversity and welcome all people regardless of ethnicity, faith, sexual orientation and gender identity.

We are bold, imaginative, respectful and compassionate.

About The Opportunity

Uniting is seeking Local Area Coordinators to be based in our Queanbeyan LAC office. The opportunity is a fixed term contract until 30 June 2019 and there is scope for the role to be full time or part time (3 or 4 days a week).

As a Local Area Coordinator with Uniting, you will be an important aspect of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS). You will work closely with people with disabilities, building goals and enabling them to direct and control their own lives. Furthermore, you will work as a Partner in the Community to build awareness and inclusivity within the local community.

Key Responsibilities Will Include
  • Meeting with participants as their first point of contact with the NDIS, assisting them with developing their goals as part of their First Plan and transitioning them onto the Scheme
  • Assisting participants to implement their plans, including building community inclusion and capacity
  • Incrementally complete scheduled plan reviews and follow up and provide support to participants as needed
  • Be a Partner in the Community, building awareness of the Scheme throughout the local area.
Skills & Experience

  • You have a minimum of 3 years relevant experience working in customer facing environments that support or provide services to people with a disability.
  • You are an active community member who is enthusiastic about supporting and empowering people with disability.
  • You have lived experience with disability, or awareness of the impact of disability, either existing or acquired, upon individuals and their involvement in the community.
  • Qualifications in a relevant field will be advantageous.


Benefits & Culture

Uniting is proud to be an EEO employer who supports an inclusive approach in the workplace. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people as well as people with a disability are encouraged to apply.
  • Play a significant role in one of the biggest social reforms since Medicare
  • Salary packaging (visit for more information)
  • Paid travel entitlements
  • Offering ongoing training and mentoring so you can continue to improve and learn new skills
  • An accessible employee assistance program to support your wellbeing
  • Career development opportunities

Click on the link below to apply. If you have any queries, please feel free to contact Rachel Shorrock on 0466 027 822 or rshorrock@uniting.org for a confidential discussion.

Employment with Uniting is subject to satisfactory background checks which may include a National Police Check and Reference Checks.
